Class ec.vatimpl.Inhabitant 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.meta.StdObj
           |
           +----ec.vatimpl.Inhabitant
public class Inhabitant
extends StdObj
Inhabitant is the superclass of all classes that know "inherently" how to live in a vat. This notably includes Guest and WrapBase. Note that as a Tether, an Inhabitant is in general a tether to itself.

Inhabitant()
Construct an Inhabitant.

getHash()
Override of java.lang.Object.

Implementation of method from ec.meta.Tether.
vat$mark(Marker)
Calls 'Marker.mark()' on each object e-pointed to by this one.

Inhabitant 
 public Inhabitant()
Construct an Inhabitant. We need to eagerly generate a hashcode since it's possible (at least in debug code) to call through to Inhabitants from outside the vat, in particular to getString() which calls getHash() by default. XXX--we may want to revisit this at a later date.

Override of java.lang.Object. Guaranteed to be deterministic.

Overrides:
invoke in class StdObj
vat$mark 
 public void vat$mark(Marker marker)
Calls 'Marker.mark()' on each object e-pointed to by this one. In the case of Inhabitant itself, there are no such objects, but subclasses must override this method if they define any e-reachable instance variables so that persistence and the EGC can find the right set of objects. Note that subclasses must also always call on the superclass.

Parameters:
marker - the Marker object that should be called for each e-reachable instance variable
